intro: Christella afzelii, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are typically evergreen and leathery. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
